content.text:
# Draft:Prradip Khairwar

| birth_place   = Mumbai, India
| other_names   = Pradip Khairwar; Prradeep Khairwar
| occupation    = Film director, producer
| years_active  = 2010s–present
| known_for     = Aayushmati Geeta Matric Pass, Blind Love
}}
Prradip Khairwar (born 1 January 1986) is an Indian film director and producer. He is known for the social-drama feature Aayushmati Geeta Matric Pass (2024) and the digital short-film series Blind Love for FNP Media.
Early life and background
Khairwar was born on 1 January 1986 in Mumbai, India. Details about his education are not publicly reported.
Career
Khairwar began his career working with filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma, serving as assistant director on Rakta Charitra and later working as an executive producer on Sarkar 3 (2017).
He made his feature directorial debut with Aayushmati Geeta Matric Pass (2024), a drama focused on girls’ education and empowerment in rural India. The film received praise from the Government of Uttar Pradesh and was discussed for potential tax-free status in the state.
Parallel to feature films, Khairwar directed the short-film franchise Blind Love for FNP Media. The series began in 2021 and includes multiple installments released on YouTube: Blind Love (2021), Blind Love 2 (2021), Blind Love 3 (2022), and Blind Love 4 (2023).
In 2025, Khairwar launched the music label Good Idea Melodies under his production banner Good Idea Films.
Filmography
; Feature films
* Aayushmati Geeta Matric Pass (2024) – Director, Producer
; Shorts and web series
* Blind Love (2021) – Director
* Blind Love 2 (2021) – Director
* Blind Love 3 (2022) – Director
* Blind Love 4 (2023) – Director
; Other credits
* Sarkar 3 (2017) – Executive Producer
Themes and style
Khairwar’s films often highlight social themes, particularly women’s rights, education, and rural social issues. His upcoming project Identity has been announced as a horror-thriller film planned to shoot in Himachal Pradesh.
Personal life
Prradip Khairwar was born in Mumbai, India, on 1 January 1986. Details of his education are not publicly reported.
